readDataValue() - Method in interface arduino_simulator.sensors.Sensor

readDataValueDigital() - Method in class arduino_simulator.sensors.PressureSensor
 
readDataValueDigital() - Method in interface arduino_simulator.sensors.Sensor
-1 indicates error, meaning some sensor that is not digital will return -1 for example digital value is of a single byte 0 - false, otherwise - true -1 indicates error and returns int since byte representation of -1 is different for int since it has 4 bytes
readDataValueDigital() - Method in class arduino_simulator.sensors.SensorImpl
used for error indication, specific sensor needs to override this method in order for it to work
READING_SENSOR_DATA - Enum constant in enum class driver_framework.response.Response
Request = none -> this response sent only while data is being read from the sensor Informs that reading is in progress, and sends read data along with it.
RELATIVE_HUMIDITY_SENSOR - Enum constant in enum class arduino_simulator.SensorType
 
Request - Enum Class in driver_framework.request
Request form | Request | BODY | 1 4 each request contains of 5 bytes 1^st byte represents request type following 4 bytes represent additional request data.
REQUEST_BODY_SIZE - Static variable in class driver_framework.request.RequestPackage
 
REQUEST_HEADER_SIZE - Static variable in class driver_framework.request.RequestPackage
 
REQUEST_SIZE - Static variable in enum class driver_framework.request.Request
 
RequestManagerThread - Class in driver_framework.request
This class continuously reads data from an input stream It checks if request abides to framework rules by checking the previous request and some additional parameters For example: START_READ request will not be executed if previous request wasn't CONNECT_SENSOR or STOP_READ wouldn't be possible if previous request wasn't START_READ This class also manages RequestObserver's behaviour according to request sent Order of appropriate Request execution: 1.
RequestManagerThread(InputStream, RequestObserver) - Constructor for class driver_framework.request.RequestManagerThread
 
RequestObserver - Interface in driver_framework.request
 
RequestPackage - Class in driver_framework.request
 
RequestPackage() - Constructor for class driver_framework.request.RequestPackage
 
Response - Enum Class in driver_framework.response
Response form has 2 types: Response field -> | Response | Body field -> | BODY | | Response | BODY | 1 4 | Response | BODY | 1 n -> n represents variables length of body, this is crucial when writing sensor's data into client's input stream each response contains of 5 bytes 1^st byte represents response type following 4 bytes represent additional response data.
